RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Doutor e mestre em Matemática Aplicada pela Universidade de São Paulo (respectivamente em 1999 e 1994). Licenciado em Matemática pela Universidade Estadual Paulista Júlio de Mesquita Filho (1988). Atualmente é professor assistente do departamento de Ciência da Computação do Instituto de Matemática e Estatística da Universidade de São Paulo (IME-USP). Tem experiência na área de Ciência da Computação, com ênfase em Informática na Educação, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: ensino à distância, geometria interativa (dinâmica), ambiente interativo de aprendizagem e avaliação automática, com interesse no desenvolvimento e aplicação de novos sistemas de apoio ao ensino (tais como iGeom, iGraf, iComb, iVProg, iMath e SAW). Com menor ênfase tem atuação em otimização contínua.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduated from State University of São Paulo (1988) with degree in Mathematics Education. He has a master (1994) and doctoral (1999) degree in Applied Mathematics from Institute of Mathematics and Statistics at University of São Paulo. Has experience in Computer Science, with special interest on the following subjects: e-learning, interactive and web software for teaching and learning (like iGeom for geometry), learning enviroment and automatic assessment.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Ensino-Aprendizagem de Matemática dos Ensinos Fundamental II e Médio apoiado por ferramentas Web interativas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto terá dois focos de observação didáticos: a verificação de aprendizagem do aluno com a utilização das TIC, assim como a análise do processo de produção de Conteúdo Didático Digital Interativo (iCDD), ambos relacionados ao currículo de Matemática. Além disso o projeto deverá resultar em aprimoramentos nos sistemas computacionais de apoio à educação desenvolvidos pelo grupo participante do LInE-IME-USP, todos a serem distribuídos na forma de software livre. Outro importante objetivo deste projeto é, ao final, disponibilizar a todos os professores interessados as ferramentas e atividades digitais desenvolvidas, criando inclusive uma comunidade virtual na qual os professores possam usar tais recursos, comentálos e, de modo geral, trabalhar colaborativamente.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: In this work, we present the software iComb - Interactive Combinatorics on Internet, a new software that can be used to teach and learning combinatorics through the Word Wide Web. The iComb is based on the Combien? experience, a software developed by Universit ́e Pierre et Marie Curie - LIP6. We can easily integrate the iComb software in a web-based learning management systeent system (LMS), as we did in two LMS, one of them was a version of Moodle system. Moreover, the iComb can be easily added to a personal web sites, social networks systems and blogs using the copy-and-past pattern resulting in a powerful collaborative tool to the conceptual movement named as Web 2.0.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract: Nowadays, people are proactive concerning Web-related issues and reasons for that could be explained by the availability of Web systems and the immediate response they provide. The same is also true whenever considering web-based courses. In this context, interactivity and automatic assessment may be responsible for keeping the learners' motivation. Also, these characteristics may promote active learning. Currently, Moodle is one of the most popular Learning Management System (LMS) to support courses through the Web. However, since it is a general system, if the subject to be taught or learnt is related to Mathematics there is a lack of interactive modules to be integrated with LMS in general, Moodle in particular. In this paper we present Interactive Assignment (i-Assign), a package to be integrated into Moodle in order to improve interactivity and promote automatic assessment of interactive activities developed using e-Learning Modules (e-LM). e-LM are interactive Java applets that supports the teaching and learning process of specific subjects and may offer resources for automatic assessment of solved activities, providing instantaneous feedback for learners concerning their performance.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract. The free system Moodle is currently one of the most important tool to support teaching and learning via the Web. However Moodle does not have yet, an integrated features to provide interactivity for students to learn. This article describes the project Interactive Assignment (IA) - i-Assign, that aims this target. Besides, it presents the first experiments of i-Assign, with math teacher and K-12 students. These experiments showed that teachers enjoyed the new feature and that students were very excited about interactive and automatic evaluation provided by the new resource i-Assign.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract. This article reports an experiment in teaching and learning Geometry by the use of Web systems in sixth grade classes of elementary school. It presents details of the course, where the students solved intuitively an area optimization problem, including limits and convergence concepts. Two major results were observed: the students' motivation, with immediate feedback by the end of the exercises, and their success in solving the challenge problem, even though it contains concepts which are not taught usually at this level. Finally, we consider that these results were due to the Interactive Geometry software.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Abstract The current intense use of the Web to support education demands the development of new educational systems that promote better interactions between learners and contents, and also improve teachers? tasks. This has implied on more complex systems and on the need to better integrate them on Web environments. This is the case of Interactive Learning Modules (iLM), a family of educational systems that can be integrated to Learning Management Systems. However, the lack of quality on development process can disturb potential benefits of using these learning tools, such as when the system behaves unexpectedly or when it takes a long time to fix this flaw. In order to reduce these problems, this work proposes a Software Product Line (SPL) for iLM, as a systematic development method. We present the design process of SPL and the creation of two iLM used to evaluate the influence of the SPL on this process. The evaluation showed better perception of productivity, code quality and programmers' satisfaction. Another contribution is an application framework, available as free software to improve the creation of new iLM.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays, there is significant growth in the human capacity resulting from widespread use of computer systems. Consequently, the logical reasoning and the knowledge of computer program- ming has been highly valued in several countries. It has been observed initiatives all over the world for its introduction since the elementary school. In this context, higher education sciences presents an apparent paradox. On the one hand there is a greater demand for graduates who know how to program computers, on the other hand literature reports a high failure rate in introductory programming courses and indicates that this demotivate many students, leading them to give up their courses. However, more recently, the literature also pointed out that the adoption of a visual programming paradigm can produce better results than the textual programming. In the visual paradigm, learners use visuals items, like flowcharts, icons and blocks, that represent commands to build the algorithms. This approach shows promising results, and has been used even with student in elementary schools. Thus, a relevant question, focus of this dissertation is whether, and how, visual programming differs from textual programming in terms of efforts made by students in the learning process. To analyse this question, was produced a new system for visual programming, the iVProg version 2, based on two dissertation works in the Laboratory of Informatics in Educa- tion (LInE) of IME-USP. The first was responsible for the first version of iVProg, and the second produced a Software Product Line (SPL). INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The distance learning (e-learning ) is strongly connected to the Information and Communication Technologies (ICT). Considering distance learning as the model in which teacher and apprentice are physically apart, we can identify its first experiences back in 1728 with the release of a course in the Boston Gazette. With the technological progress, the interactivity in the distance learning courses also increased. While the first course was based on letters, nowadays a distance learning course student, with the World Wide Web (Web ) support, can receive more assistance than an student in a presencial course. However, in 2008 another course model emerge in the distance learning area which, in certain way, recovers the old model of exchanging letters courses, in which there were few or none interaction between apprentice and teacher. They are online courses with a great number of students enrolled, and for this reason are called are supported only and exclusively in MOOC (Massive Open Online Course). These courses are supported only and exclusively in Web technologies and most of the times do not require a prerequisite or give a certificate. Another usual factor is the high high number of dropouts, around 95%. In this context, the challenge of this work is to examine the causes related to content and presentation format that can have an impact in the students motivation and in addition to propose a model aiming the students commitment. In order to do so, it is presented a Geometry MOOC to elementary school, using interactive tools such as the iGeom, an Interactive Geometry (IG) software, beyond other medias, as audios, videos, and animations. This model was tested with students of public schools, presenting good results.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The expansion of the model of Distance Learning (ODL) and the presence increasingly constant of Information Technology and Communication (ICT) in the classroom teaching model, make es- sential use of computational tools as an aid to teachers for both content production digital, as the task of assessing learning. The assessment of learning however, entails a lot of work to the teacher, especially those forma- tive character, that favoring the continued development of the student learning. One way to alleviate this workload has been the use of Course Management Systems (CMS). Among these systems is Moodle, which provides the Quiz module, used for creating assessments with automatic correction. However its use is complex and often appear usability problems that hinder the efficient use, well as the motivation of the users. This work addresses the difficulties of the teachers to produce assessment quizzes in Moodle. Aiming to reduce these difficulties, a survey to identify the main elements that interfere into the usability of the tools authoring online, was conducted.The results were used in the modeling and prototyping of an alternative to the environment Quiz module, called iQuiz, which resulted in the following technological contribution: an interface for application to the core of the Quiz and a model for integration of components involved in the composition of the new environment. For the creation of the prototype has been applied to approach to development focused on the user, using usability tests together with other methods, such as heuristic evaluation. This resulted in significant improvement in the quality of the final interface and consequently, greater user satisfaction, an essential factor to motivate them to use the new environment.
Keywords: Computers in education, Authorship, Assessment, Learning environments, Usability.
